definitions.text: stringed instruments that are played with a bow
a tightly stretched cord of wire or gut, which makes sound when plucked, struck, or bowed
a sequentially ordered set of things or events or ideas in which each successive member is related to the preceding
a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases)
a tie consisting of a cord that goes through a seam around an opening
examples: he pulled the drawstring and closed the bag

definitions.text: a tough piece of fiber in vegetables, meat, or other food (especially the tough fibers connecting the two halves of a bean pod)
(cosmology) a hypothetical one-dimensional subatomic particle having a concentration of energy and the dynamic properties of a flexible loop
a collection of objects threaded on a single strand
a necklace made by a stringing objects together
thread on or as if on a string
examples: the child drew glass beads on a string

definitions.text: add as if on a string
examples: string up these songs and you'll have a musical

definitions.text: stretch out or arrange like a string
string together; tie or fasten with a string
